title: When Riot tells you their system bans trolls/int feeders
body:
Now, I understand this has to happen to some people because trolls have to actually do something to be reported, but Riot...

https://i.imgur.com/qR1Qpu0.png

Why was this person doing the same thing they did today, 7 days ago? Can the system NOT detect them? Does it take time? Because I'd understand like 20 minutes, but 7 days? And I doubt nobody reported that person. In my game they asked for a role swap, got it, inted mid, and then sold their items to buy 2 mobi boots and run down bot. Come on Riot, how you gonna do me dirty like this? If the system can't do it that fast, I'll gladly look at reports by players. Only takes 15~ minutes to skin a replay/chat/builds.

replies.body:
Because those aren't their actual builds. They are selling their items and re-buying when the game is over.

----

I watched the entire replay of that game, and they were NOT feeding. They got wrecked by a Fizz.

1.) Died under own turret in a close fight.
2.) Ulted by fizz from the jungle pathing in from drag side. Tried to run to safety of turret.
3.) Died under own turret.
4.) Died under own turret.

They were trying their best to stay alive the entire time, and were returning damage under their own turret. They got outplayed. They sold their items after respawn in the fountain when the surrender came through.

This was not a case of intentional feeding. They were not running mid to die. Players having a bad game is not an excuse to accuse them of intentional feeding.

Riot themselves dont give a single shit about actual players, they let their automatic system do everything. I was a toxic player, i admit that, but i stopped after a 14 day ban, stopped even mostly talking at all in game. But then a single game, where i had a support that inted 3 times in bot lane then went afk, where the jungler literally decided it was better to finish the  enemy raptors instead of help me and counter gank, when i was running right to him, then say "I was there dude", and later int for the rest of the game, and trap us in the game after our top laner went afk as well. Like literally run into 5 people every time he spawned, and refuse to surrender. Where the other team responded to me asking them to just push mid and end because of our 2 afk players, and our inting jungler, by hunting me down anywhere i went for the rest of the game, and refusing to end. This ridiculous game, i got reported by the other team for just wanting the game to end, and i got an instant permanent ban, From One SIngle game, when i had literally stopped talking to people because it wasnt worth losing my account. Riot only cared about their automatic system and takes it as gospel, when more likely than not, now in todays community you are going to get reported more likely for playing bad than actual toxicity. I have submitted a ticket and sent response after response, my ticket has been pushed to a second person now and all i get is a cut and paste response from someone who refusus to actually watch the game and see what was going on. Riot really doesnt care about what their system is doing, how bad it is, the way it enables toxic players who know how to bend the system. They are in it for the money and nothing else.
The fact that you can't keep this in your post alone says alot

Oh, i have a post of my own, but refusal from the rioters looking at my ticket to actually look at the game and just send me cut and paste responses made me want to post this everywhere i possibly could.
If they refuse to look at your ticket that's something, but if they look and see that you deserved the ban from your chat logs or whatever is a different story.
The thing is, i specifically asked them to watch the game to see what was going on, and i get the cut and paste response that "I have reviewed the logs", they refuse to look at the actual game.
What would looking at the game do?

They would see what was actually going on, just reviewing the logs doesn't paint the entire picture, there are many forms of toxicity, mine in this single game was born from frustration because of the much much worse toxicity in this game.

It doesn't matter what the situation is. You're team is already dealing with enough bs from these people and then you started to be toxic, adding more fuel to the fire. Everyone has bad games, everyone has to deal with trolls/feeders/toxic players but most of us just keep our cool. You of all people should have kept your cool if you've had punishments in the past.

My team wast dealing with bs from these people, they were the bs, 2 players afk, and a toxic jungler, on my team. they weren't dealing, they were the problem, while yes, i shouldnt have responded, getting punished because i just wanted the game to end isnt right.

Trying to retaliate or anything just gets you no where and you pretty much always get punished. Riot is working on a new system and in a couple patches we should have a new algorithm or something to detect inters/feeders/ and trolls and ban them faster only time will tell though.

The new system being worked on still doesnt change the fact that i got banned because i was a literal hostage in that game, i couldnt afk because of my previous toxicity, which i freely admit to, and i had stopped. I had completely stopped after my 14 day ban, and being a hostage in literally the most toxic game i have ever played, and then get banned because of it...

Looking at your log, it was alot more toxic than i thought it would be, all you had to do was play the game out and keep quite. This is why they won't watch the game because this is way more than enough after a 14 day. Still a really shitty situation tho.

Every single thing i said in that game was in response to being held hostage, yes, i should have just kept quiet, i understand that, but being held a literal hostage in the game, i think that game should just be disregarded completely.

Yea but if you do that then you have to disregard every other game that someone has been toxic in due to afk, trolls, feeders, toxic players. And i'm sure you've been in games before where you have someone flaming their ass off because of something like this and it sucks and you wouldn't want them unbanned or that game to be a free pass because of something like that.

Literally the only person in that entire game that wasn't toxic was my ADC, all other 9 players were, including me, but mine was born of frustration because of the other 8, i never quit trying to play the game, through all that, i just wanted it to end. While CS:GO is a shite game that valve has zero chance of turning around, can't rito take a page out of their book and allow people to anonymously review cases of rule-breakers? Wouldn't be too hard to implement, and would have a ton of volunteers for it.

Back in the days when the tribunal was around (granted it was for chat only purposes), there was so much back log that people weren't punished for a loooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooonnnngggg time. 

When they did get punished, it was so far down the road that they already forgot about those games, making them go "WTF!?!?!?! when did this happen??"

If humans were to review games for trolling / inting, there is a high possibility that the same thing would happen again.

The problem of course being that now the punishment system is so exploitable that any idiot with common sense can get around it ("I'm doing the new meta, where I buy 6 tears and run down mid. 70% winrate!"). While it may include a backlog if done incorrectly (the community reviews ALL of them), the future essentially lies with this method as it's kinda the most accurate one they have.
